unnormalised: ## Ditch the CDs, Embrace the Stream: Music's New Tune!
normalised: ## Ditch the C D s, Embrace the Stream: Music's New Tune!

unnormalised: Hey guys, remember the days of painstakingly copying CDs onto your computer? Or carefully curating your MP3 library, agonizing over ID3 tags? Well, those days are thankfully behind us, thanks to the magic of music streaming!
normalised: Hey guys, remember the days of painstakingly copying C D s onto your computer? Or carefully curating your M P three library, agonizing over I D three tags? Well, those days are thankfully behind us, thanks to the magic of music streaming!

unnormalised: Forget lugging around bulky CD players on your trips from Delhi to Mumbai. Now, all you need is your phone and a decent internet connection, and boom, you've got access to millions of songs. From A.R. Rahman's classic melodies to the latest Bollywood bangers, everything's right at your fingertips.
normalised: Forget lugging around bulky C D players on your trips from Delhi to Mumbai. Now, all you need is your phone and a decent internet connection, and boom, you've got access to millions of songs. From A R Rahman's classic melodies to the latest Bollywood bangers, everything's right at your fingertips.

unnormalised: I remember watching "Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge" and immediately wanting to download every single song. Now, I can just add the entire soundtrack to my playlist with a click! No more hunting for dodgy download links or risking viruses. Thank God for progress, right?
normalised: I remember watching "Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge" and immediately wanting to download every single song. Now, I can just add the entire soundtrack to my playlist with a click! No more hunting for dodgy download links or risking viruses. Thank God for progress, right?

unnormalised: The sheer convenience is insane. I can create playlists for every mood, discover new artists from around the globe, and even listen to curated playlists based on my listening habits. My commute to IIT Madras is now a much more bearable experience.
normalised: The sheer convenience is insane. I can create playlists for every mood, discover new artists from around the globe, and even listen to curated playlists based on my listening habits. My commute to I I T Madras is now a much more bearable experience.

unnormalised: And let's talk about the cost. While subscription fees might seem a bit much at first, think about how much you used to spend on buying albums. Plus, most streaming services offer student discounts and family plans to make it even more affordable. Some are as low as Rs. 99 per month!
normalised: And let's talk about the cost. While subscription fees might seem a bit much at first, think about how much you used to spend on buying albums. Plus, most streaming services offer student discounts and family plans to make it even more affordable. Some are as low as rupee ninety nine per month!

unnormalised: Of course, some audiophiles argue that streaming doesn't offer the same audio quality as a physical CD. While that might be true to some extent, the average listener probably won't notice a huge difference. And honestly, the convenience outweighs any minor loss in fidelity for me.
normalised: Of course, some audiophiles argue that streaming doesn't offer the same audio quality as a physical C D. While that might be true to some extent, the average listener probably won't notice a huge difference. And honestly, the convenience outweighs any minor loss in fidelity for me.

unnormalised: So, are you still clinging to your old CDs and MP3s? It's time to embrace the future of music. Download a streaming app (Spotify, Apple Music, JioSaavn – take your pick!) and start exploring the vast world of music that awaits you. Trust me, you won't regret it! Happy listening, everyone!
normalised: So, are you still clinging to your old C D s and M P threes? It's time to embrace the future of music. Download a streaming app (Spotify, Apple Music, JioSaavn – take your pick!) and start exploring the vast world of music that awaits you. Trust me, you won't regret it! Happy listening, everyone!
